body: Toulmouche received his early training from his uncle and Amedeo Rene Menard, both sculptors in the port city of Nantes, France. He received additional training from the portraitist Biron who taught in Nantes. At the age of seventeen he left for Paris and studied under the Swiss painter Charles Gleyre. This provided the direction he needed and in 1848 he was ready for his Salon debut. In 1852 Emperor Napoleon III purchased one of Toulmouche's paintingsââLa Fille

. With his reputation assured, he continued to paint charming domestic scenesâmothers and children and young women.

Toulmouche was expert at âcostume painting
dimensions: Oil on cradled wood panel, 11.75 x 9.25 inches / Signed and dated lower left
